alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Okfuskee County through 400 PM CDT... At 329 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Pharoah to 3 miles southwest of Earlsboro. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Okemah... Weleetka... Bearden... Clearview... Pharoah... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
